thread.title: Fans can plan on a great night of rock
thread.title_full: Fans can plan on a great night of rock

title: Fans can plan on a great night of rock
text:
Fans can plan on a great night of rock Joshua Adamson | 1st Oct 2015 5:00 AM ALTERNATIVE SOUND: The Getaway Plan is ready to rock the Racehorse Hotel tonight. Popular Stories Local Real Estate Cars For Sale 
THE men of The Getaway Plan are excited about bringing their alternative rock to the Racehorse Hotel again. 
While the band predominately plays alternative rock, on their latest record they delved into both blues and country sounds. 
Lead singer Matthew Wright and lead guitarist Clint Owen Ellis formed the band in 2003 out of high school, not content with just playing in a small punk band together. 
The duo dreamed of bigger things and, after tracking down other band members, The Getaway Plan was born. 
Matthew and Clint are the only founding members still with the band but after amazing crowds for more than a decade they haven't shown any signs of slowing down. 
Expect a plethora of The Getaway Plan's hits at their performance, from their first demo to their current record. The band last played at the Racehorse in 2013 during their Lovesick Tour and Matthew said they enjoyed it so much they knew they had to come back. 
The Getaway Plan will perform at the Racehorse Hotel tonight from 8pm. 
Tickets are $20 plus a booking fee pre-sale or $25 at the door. 
For more information about the show or to buy tickets online, visit racehorsehotel.com.au racehorse hotel
